building_name: Bowery - Bare-brick Boutique
description: What was once a no-man’s land a century ago is now the must-visit neighborhood for hip New Yorkers. The Bowery - though keeping its industrial, downtown vibe - is constantly changing with new cafes, bars and restaurants. This retail space for rent has exposed brick all over, and there's an outdoor space too.
title: Bowery - Bare-brick Boutique

building_name: Mott Street, Nolita - Boutique Space
description: Nolita is in the center of some of New York City's most popular shopping destinations like the Village, Union Square, and SoHo. And this neighborhood has some retail cred of its own with indie boutiques like Babel Fair, Josie Natori, and big brands like REI that can be your neighbors. Let your ideas come to life in this intimate, old-school New York ground-level retail space. There's lots of potential for creative displays on the slat shelves built into the exposed brick walls. The floor-to-ceiling windows and glass door add lots of light to the sales area, and there's lots of storage for product in the back room. The area is always busy thanks to foot traffic from those looking for a little culture at the New Museum, dining along Prince Street, or looking for the perfect outfit. R/W/F trains are three blocks away.
title: Mott Street, Nolita - Boutique Space

building_name: Roebling Street, Williamsburg - Retail Space
description: Williamsburg has seen quite the transformation since the late 1990s. Once a European enclave, it's now a world center for contemporary art, music, fashion, and cuisine. Packed with lovely side streets and low-rise buildings, locals and tourists frequent this neighborhood to get a major dose of Brooklyn culture. On the corner of Roebling Street and Metropolitan Avenue, this converted warehouse has been around since 1907. Just a few steps up from the busy street, this 3,100 square-foot space has all of the old-school atmosphere one would expect from Williamsburg. In fact, it was formerly a vintage furniture store. High ceilings, hardwood floors, exposed brick, and floor-to-ceiling windows give the space a bright, airy feel. There are plenty of bars, cafes, boutiques, and restaurants, like Pies n’ Thighs nearby. And right next door is the popular Roebling Tea Room. Four blocks away is the L/G train Lorimer subway stop.
title: Roebling Street, Williamsburg - Retail Space

building_name: Williamsburg – Bedford Avenue Pop Up
description: One thing you can say about Williamsburg: It’s never dull. Bedford Avenue is Williamsburg’s commercial street, where big brands sit next to independent boutiques. Formerly home to big names like Toms and Vans, this retail space is now available to rent.
title: Williamsburg – Bedford Avenue Pop Up

building_name: Leonard Street, Tribeca - Lower Level Gallery Space
description: Tribeca is one of Manhattan’s most notable neighborhoods. With stunning architecture, great dining options, and a cadre of celebrity residents, it’s easy to see why. The district is the sum of its past - from hub of industry to center of art to one of the most desirable areas in NYC, where cast-iron facade walkups give way to glass skyscrapers. Amid it all is this massive underground space. The area is divided into two rooms, the first of which is home to a large red desk that can be used for reception, as a wrap desk, or to display products. The second area closes off with privacy screens and comes with a projector. Throughout the space, white walls, light-gray wood floors, and high ceilings give the room an art-gallery vibe. And even though the space is below ground, light is still plentiful thanks to the ample track lighting. Leonard Street is in the heart of Tribeca and gets the foot traffic those working downtown, tourists, and residents. And this space is right off of the Canal Street subway stop.
title: Leonard Street, Tribeca - Lower Level Gallery Space

building_name: East 27th Street - Unique Space
description: Over the past decade, Nomad has become a neighborhood that’s associated with taste and style. From the can’t-get-a-reservation restaurants like Eleven Madison Square Park to the burgeoning interior design district, this area is full of well-heeled consumers. On a quiet block off of hectic 5th Avenue is this vast space that’s brimming with possibilities. It is a rather storied location that's currently under construction. With sturdy columns, brick walls, and concrete floors there’s lots of potential. Polyform, B&B Italia, DDC, and Restoration Hardware are nearby as is the Mario Batali’s culinary staple Eataly. In addition, many train stations and buses are just a few minutes away.
title: East 27th Street - Unique Space

building_name: E 9th Street - Narrow Retail Space
description: Crisp white, long and narrow – this space is as unique as its neighborhood, the East Village. A classic New York space, it sits right on Tompkins Square Park and is next to a gallery and vintage furniture boutique. For the adventurous artist or retail startup, it's perfect for showcasing. High ceilings, a 15" window and LED track lighting brighten the space, making it feel larger than it is. A small backroom is available on request, and a projector faces the entrance, with a portable screen for showings. There is little foot traffic in this part of the neighborhood, so attraction and a unique draw is key. The nearest subway is seven blocks away, however city buses run through the neighborhood (which is mainly residential). A quiet block is hard to find in New York, but this space makes the best of the surrounding, laid-back ambiance with a minimalist approach.
title: E 9th Street - Narrow Retail Space

building_name: Grand Street, Soho - Hardwood Retail Shop
description: Soho is the destination for great shopping, and this large pop up retail space for rent on Grand Street is in a great location. The hardwood floors, black columns, and antiqued mirrors make this venue unique.
title: Grand Street, Soho - Hardwood Retail Shop

building_name: West 56th Street, Midtown - The Flagship Showroom
description: There’s almost no place in New York City that gets more foot traffic from shoppers around the globe than 5th Avenue. In fact, the thoroughfare's name is synonymous with high style and glamor. It’s where people from around the world flock to for the latest fashions. Built in 1901 and formerly home to Hollywood royalty Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton, this prime Midtown building oozes sophistication and elegance. In this six-floor townhouse to rent, three floors are co-working spaces and the other three are dedicated retail or showroom spaces. With a mix polished concrete, dark hardwood, and marble floors, high ceilings, and lots of natural light there’s no other way to describe it than stunning. A spiral staircase runs from the ground floor to the top floor, and each story in between has intricate design details and lots of windows. The ceilings are also high, adding a sense of more grandeur to the interior. Centrally located in the heart of Manhattan just three blocks south of Central Park, this space is easy to get to with almost all major Manhattan trains a few blocks away including the N/R or the 5th Avenue bus.
title: West 56th Street, Midtown - The Flagship Showroom

building_name: West Village’s Perry Street Space
description: Known for its tree-lined cobblestone streets, the West Village is full of beautiful homes, wonderful bars and restaurants, jazz venues, and this natural light-filled retail or event space for rent on Perry Street.
title: West Village’s Perry Street Space

building_name: Hudson Street, Tribeca – Two Floor Showroom
description: Tribeca's cobblestoned streets and luxury lofts aren't only a playground for the well-connected. Visitors from all over come to dine in famous restaurants like Wolfgang's Steakhouse and shop in the fashion boutiques that prominently make up the neighborhood, including Shinola and Issey Miyake. On Hudson Street, this two-floor brightly-colored showroom can be rented for retail and events. It comes with a storage room and an elevator for easy access.
title: Hudson Street, Tribeca – Two Floor Showroom

building_name: Williamsburg North 3rd Street Market, West Storefront
description: Williamsburg is the home of all things trendy in Brooklyn, from hip bars and restaurants, to markets like Smorgasburg and this pop-up retail space for rent in the North 3rd Street Market. Get your retail or F&B idea in front of a huge roster of vendors, including the pizza legends Di Fara and burger icons Corner Bistro.
title: Williamsburg North 3rd Street Market, West Storefront

building_name: West 125th Street, Harlem – Retail Space
description: Set up shop around the corner from one the iconic Martin Luther King Boulevard and one of the most famous Soul food restaurants in the city and well-known stores and bars including American Eagle, Red Rooster and Whole Foods. This Harlem shop space (formerly home to Verizon) is available to rent for retail, events or showroom use.
title: West 125th Street, Harlem – Retail Space

building_name: Bleecker Street, West Village - The Old Purple Bakery
description: Bleecker Street is home to some of the city's best food options like John's Pizzeria, Grom Gelato, Murray's Cheese Shop, and Tacombi Taco. Add your brand to this culinary pantheon at this charming corner space. With plenty of counter space, floor-to- ceiling windows, built-in shelving, seating and a chevron floor, this former bakery is move-in ready. There are two large service areas, including a prep area in the back, which are perfect to display any edible delight or accessories. The basement level is large and clean and also great for storage. This corner is in the center of downtown NYC and is a favorite of New Yorkers and tourist who regularly frequent the neighborhood. And it's easily accessible via 1/E/C trains all of which are just around the block.
title: Bleecker Street, West Village - The Old Purple Bakery

building_name: The Bowery’s Corner Showroom
description: Located on the corner of Bowery and Rivington, this showroom or event space for rent is in a great location, on one of the busiest streets in the Lower East Side.
title: The Bowery’s Corner Showroom

building_name: Elizabeth Street, Nolita - Blue Fronted Flexible Space
description: No matter the time of day or night, the streets of Nolita, which means North of Little Italy, are full of life. Heels click on the pavement as visitors shop at fashion-forward boutiques like Love Adorned and indulge in NYC’s culinary scene at Egg Shop and Butcher's Daughter. Off of quaint Elizabeth Street is this dynamic ground-floor space that’s bright and airy. The white box space is ready for you to transform.
title: Elizabeth Street, Nolita - Blue Fronted Flexible Space

building_name: Elizabeth Street – The White Boutique
description: Known for its designer jewelry stores, fashion boutiques, and sidewalk cafes, Nolita is a neighborhood that attracts the fashionably casual crowd. Elizabeth Street is a tree-lined stretch of road with a wide range of unique stores for shoppers to leisurely peruse. This retail shop for rent features elegant hardwood floors and comes with a storage space in the back. View the floor plan for this space.
title: Elizabeth Street – The White Boutique

building_name: Bedford Avenue, Williamsburg – Brick Warehouse Space
description: Welcome to where the vinyl records never stop spinning, the vintage clothing supply never runs dry, and a new, concept-heavy café seems to open every minute. When it comes to tasting the type of homegrown-cool that put Williamsburg on the map, you could say that all roads (or at least the L train) lead to Bedford Avenue. This unique two-level retail space for rent has all the aesthetic benefits of a Bushwick-inspired warehouse, with the bonus of actually having Bedford bragging rights.
title: Bedford Avenue, Williamsburg – Brick Warehouse Space

building_name: Rivington Street, Lower East Side - Contemporary Pop Up Space
description: From vintage fashion markets to art exhibits and counterculture gatherings, this contemporary gallery space on Rivington Street has seen all kinds of affairs. With its 10-foot- tall glass storefront, minimal, all-white interior and even a small kitchenette in the back, it is the ideal location for a wide range of pop-up events in one of New York’s most coveted neighborhoods. View the floorplan for this space.
title: Rivington Street, Lower East Side - Contemporary Pop Up Space

building_name: Mulberry Street, Nolita - The Bright White Boutique
description: One of New York’s most exclusive neighborhoods, Nolita provides both the quiet charm of a residential area and the chic atmosphere of a high-end shopping district. Mulberry street’s wide collection of clothing boutiques, specialty shops, cafes, and restaurants draw an eclectic bunch of locals and shoppers looking for an experience a bit calmer than that of the surrounding neighborhoods. On this same street, you'll find this pristinely-tiled, brightly-lit retail space to rent.
title: Mulberry Street, Nolita - The Bright White Boutique

building_name: Madison Avenue, Manhattan - The Grey and Glass Store
description: Madison Avenue is the gateway to a world of luxury and flagship designer boutiques. Let your knees buckle for the grandeur of the Upper East Side. Between its stately white façade and enviable postcode, this clothing retail shop has two floors of smart selling space for a high-end brand to rent.
title: Madison Avenue, Manhattan - The Grey and Glass Store

building_name: Madison Avenue , Manhattan - The Black Store
description: Just on Madison Avenue is this small, clean and brand new retail space available to rent. The space is available for a month minimum; making it a great space for individuals or businesses that need a location for a short amount of time; with scope of possibly staying longer if they need to as there is no maximum time set.
title: Madison Avenue , Manhattan - The Black Store

building_name: Second Avenue , East Village - The Corner Restaurant
description: The East Village is known for its bars, brunches, and live music, among other things, and this pop up bar and restaurant for rent on 2nd Ave and 7th Street is ready for you to move in.
title: Second Avenue , East Village - The Corner Restaurant

building_name: West Broadway , Soho - The Flagship Space
description: This large, beautiful retail space is available to rent in Soho’s centre. The sprawling location is available at a two week minimum book – ideal for an event or exhibition with numerous dates. The space is completely empty and ready for someone to really make it their own.
title: West Broadway , Soho - The Flagship Space

building_name: Wooster Street, Soho - The Green Tree Retail Space
description: Soho is where you head for the best shopping, eating, and people watching in New York, and this large pop up retail space for rent on Wooster Street could be home for your brand.
title: Wooster Street, Soho - The Green Tree Retail Space

building_name: Grand Street, Williamsburg - The Wellness Space
description: Williamsburg might be known for its hipster/struggling artist vibe, but it’s residents are also very health oriented. This pop up space for rent was formerly a pilates studio, so it would best be used as a similar wellness business.
title: Grand Street, Williamsburg - The Wellness Space

building_name: Avenue of the Americas
description: Midtown is the heartbeat of Manhattan, home to Times Square, neon lights, taxi stands, and this large pop up retail store for rent on 6th Ave. With the amount of hotels, shops and restaurants in the area, there are always people around, and this area truly never sleeps.
title: Avenue of the Americas

building_name: Franklin Place , Tribeca - The Gallery Space
description: On a quiet little side street in Tribeca, Lower Manhattan is an ideal commercial space for people wanting to make a name in the arts world. The space is a functioning gallery with booths available to rent for art installations and exhibitions; without needing to alter the space too much.
title: Franklin Place , Tribeca - The Gallery Space

building_name: W 25th, Chelsea - The Brick Gallery
description: Ideal for an art gallery, events, or photo shoot, this pop up space for rent is on W 25th Street in artsy Chelsea.
title: W 25th, Chelsea - The Brick Gallery

building_name: Allen Street, Lower East Side - The Narrow Store
description: The Lower East Side has a storied history, from the crowded tenements of the 19th century, to the punk squatters of the 1980s and 90s. These days you can always find good music, food and drink, and art in the LES, and this pop up gallery space for rent on Allen Street feels right at home.
title: Allen Street, Lower East Side - The Narrow Store

building_name: West 77th , Upper West Side - The Window Front Store
description: Located on the ground floor of a new boutique residential building, is this newly renovated pop up retail space for rent. You’ll be right between Central Park and Riverside Park, located in one of the nicest areas of Manhattan.
title: West 77th , Upper West Side - The Window Front Store

building_name: Madison Avenue - The Manhattan Store
description: Just blocks away from Central Park, this bright and modern pop up retail shop on Madison Avenue is ready for the Upper East Side’s next boutique.
title: Madison Avenue - The Manhattan Store

building_name: Hooper Street, Williamsburg - The Red Brick Corner Shop
description: This pop up space for rent on Hooper Street in Williamsburg is currently a co-working space, but would also be great as a retail shop, gallery, or boutique. The duplex offers plenty of space for storage, as well as for displaying goods.
title: Hooper Street, Williamsburg - The Red Brick Corner Shop

building_name: 2nd Avenue - Commercial Space in Turtle Bay’s Social Scene
description: Located on Second Avenue at E 50th Street, this commercial space for rent is located firmly in Turtle Bay’s social hotspot. Here, you’ll be surrounded by cool businesses and affluent residents. The space itself is a blank canvas that’s easily adaptable for your next project and is highly visible from the bustling Second Avenue.
street: 2nd Avenue - Commercial Space in Turtle Bay’s Social Scen
title: 2nd Avenue - Commercial Space in Turtle Bay’s Social Scene

building_name: Troutman Street, Bushwick - The Bus Pop Up
description: Give your shoppers an experience they won’t soon forget. This converted school bus is adaptable, photogenic, and fully outfitted for your next brand takeover. Currently located in Bushwick, Brooklyn’s supremely bohemian neighborhood, this inventive pop-up space for rent is surrounded by street art, converted warehouses, and conscious shoppers looking for hidden gems.
title: Troutman Street, Bushwick - The Bus Pop Up

building_name: Broadway, Bushwick - The Studio Space
description: Located at the intersection of Williamsburg, Bed Stuy, and Bushwick, this newly renovated pop up space for rent on Broadway would be great for anything from an event space to a retail store. There is wood flooring throughout, and nice tall windows on the front.
title: Broadway, Bushwick - The Studio Space

building_name: Broadway, Bushwick – The Black Storefront
description: Affectionately known as the little brother to Williamsburg, Bushwick is gaining a reputation as Brooklyn's new place to be. And it has all the markings for it: graffitied streets, themed dive bars, and an abundance of converted warehouse lofts. Located on Broadway – the main avenue that connects Williamsburg to eastern Brooklyn – is this newly painted retail space for rent.
title: Broadway, Bushwick – The Black Storefront

building_name: Delancey Street, Lower East Side - The White Store
description: Tucked away nicely in Manhattan’s Bowery neighbourhood, this space is located in a prime area available immediately and ready for your idea! Nestled in the middle of Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy a few blocks away, this location is perfect for anyone in search of an area with loads of diversity.
title: Delancey Street, Lower East Side - The White Store

building_name: Crosby Street, Soho - The Sub Level Space
description: On a quiet corner in the heart of New York’s Soho district is a sizeable commercial space available for as little or long as you need it. The white space is a great blank canvas for a smaller scale boutique, company event/s or even an art gallery.
title: Crosby Street, Soho - The Sub Level Space

building_name: 20th Street, Park Slope - The White Event Space
description: Equally suited for a soirée or product launch, this event space for rent is ready to play host to your next gathering. The crisp, adaptable space is located in the Park Slope neighborhood of Brooklyn, in a section welcoming a wave of creative entrepreneurs.
title: 20th Street, Park Slope - The White Event Space

building_name: The Franklin Avenue Boutique, Crown Heights
description: Unpretentious, entertaining and lively, Franklin Avenue is full of Brooklyn cool but without the attitude. A self-contained foodie haven, this is where Brooklynites in the know come to dine out. And in the middle of all that is this bright and airy pop-up retail space to let, formerly used by DC Comics and Reebok.
title: The Franklin Avenue Boutique, Crown Heights

building_name: Rivington Street , Lower East Side - Exposed Brick Pop Up
description: The Lower East Side has its share of famous restaurants, dive bars, shopping, and this pop up retail shop on Rivington Street. The interior has partially exposed bricks, placing the history of the building on full display.
title: Rivington Street , Lower East Side - Exposed Brick Pop Up

building_name: West 42nd Street - The Times Square Flagship Space
description: It doesn’t get much more iconic than neon, the theatres, the shopping and the energy of Times Square. With a large geometric shop front, and a huge basement, you can launch your idea among the retail giants with this two-floor flagship space to rent at the intersection of 42nd Street and Broadway.
street: West 42nd Street - The Times Square Flagship Spac
title: West 42nd Street - The Times Square Flagship Space

building_name: West 57th Street, Hell's Kitchen - The Brand New Retail Space
description: The recent revival in Hell’s Kitchen has brought in lots of new residential buildings to the area, including the much-anticipated VIA 57 West building. Make your new home in this retail commercial space for rent on the ground floor of the soon-to-be iconic tetrahedron-shaped building.
title: West 57th Street, Hell's Kitchen - The Brand New Retail Space

building_name: Second House Road, Montauk - Boutique Hotel Outdoor Retail Space
description: Situated on the grounds of a boutique hotel just near Fort Pond is this lovely luxurious outdoor pop up retail space at the Sole East Resort.
title: Second House Road, Montauk - Boutique Hotel Outdoor Retail Space

building_name: Congress Avenue, Downtown Austin - The Hub Forum
description: This open air alcove brings the energy and bustle from the surrounding streets into its midst. Meandering down from the State Capital to Lady Bird Lake, Congress Street hits its stride when it meets 5th at 401 Congress. Live music venues, inventive bars/restaurants, quirky theaters live alongside tech incubators, creative co-working spaces, and even Fortune 500 companies. This large open space is the perfect place to exhibit a new product. Cool brands like Tesla have showcased their cars here.
title: Congress Avenue, Downtown Austin - The Hub Forum

building_name: Congress Avenue, Downtown - The SXSW Retail Space
description: Directly off the entrance to 600 Congress is a small shop positioned ideally to take advantage of the building’s existing foot traffic and also gain the attention from the folks outside. Sixth Street and Congress Avenue are the main intersection of Austin’s walkable, bikeable metropolis. It is Mecca for creative tech with an outsized music and food scene. The shop is ready to be a part of this thriving community. It has built-in shelves and refrigerators, perfect for a newsstand/cafe along with abundant natural light and space for seating.
title: Congress Avenue, Downtown - The SXSW Retail Space

building_name: Congress Avenue, Austin - The Open Performance Space
description: Situated in the atrium of 600 Congress Ave positions you among Austin’s premier exhibition spaces. Famously known at the “Live Music Capital of the World,” Austin, and this particularly street, has come to epitomize immersive performance culture which culminates with South by Southwest and Austin City Limits. This space draws people towards a central atrium with cascading steps that double as seating, making it the perfect place for music performances, book readings, or interviews.
title: Congress Avenue, Austin - The Open Performance Space

building_name: Second House Road, Montauk - Boutique Hotel Indoor Retail Space
description: Located in a boutique hotel just near Fort Pond is this lovely luxurious pop up retail space in the Sole East Resort.
title: Second House Road, Montauk - Boutique Hotel Indoor Retail Space

building_name: Washington Street, Soho - The Restaurant Take Over
description: Tribeca is one of New York’s wealthiest areas, home to celebrities and some of the cities best restaurants like Little Park and Takahachi. Hold your next party here on Washington Street at this large restaurant and pop up event space for rent.
title: Washington Street, Soho - The Restaurant Take Over

building_name: Broadway, Tribeca - Two Floor Basement Event Space
description: Nestled on the border of Tribeca and Chinatown is this large two floor pop up event space for rent that would be ideal for parties, gallery shows, or other events looking for a unique space with a Brooklyn feel in Lower Manhattan.
title: Broadway, Tribeca - Two Floor Basement Event Space

building_name: Lafayette Street, Noho - The Corner Advertising Wall
description: Located on the corner of Lafayette and Houston, this event space for rent can be either painted or covered in a vinyl print. On a corner with constant traffic, this space can be used for a product launch or big event where you can brand the wall, so your signage will be visible by tons of commuters daily.
title: Lafayette Street, Noho - The Corner Advertising Wall

building_name: Prospect place, Crown Heights - The Nostrand Pop Up
description: Crown Heights has gained a reputation as one of Brooklyn’s hidden gem hangouts. New cocktail bars and health-food cafés are increasing the buzz and paying homage to the history of the neighborhood at the same time. This retail space for rent is located on a corner of Nostrand Avenue, a main street for the area, with neighborhood favorites and a new residential development located right outside the front door.
title: Prospect place, Crown Heights - The Nostrand Pop Up

building_name: East Harlem - The Red Door Pop Up
description: Located on this always-busy part of 1st Ave, this pop up retail space for rent includes an outdoor backyard, and is in an up-and-coming area of Manhattan.
street: East Harlem - The Red Door Pop U
title: East Harlem - The Red Door Pop Up

building_name: Wall Street - Huge Period Event Space
description: Wall Street is an address known around the globe, and is often seen as the financial capital of the world. It’s home to the world’s two largest stock exchanges, as well as this large pop up event space for rent just across from the NYSE.
street: Wall Street - Huge Period Event Spac
title: Wall Street - Huge Period Event Space

building_name: 6th Avenue, West Village - The Park View Store
description: This beautiful space is located at the convergence of Sixth Avenue, Greenwich Avenue, and Christopher Street in the West Village, Manhattan’s most charming neighborhood. Set among old brick storefronts and between two parks, this retail and event space offers a prime location with exposed brick walls bathed in natural light. You’ll have views of the iconic brick castle that is the Jefferson Market Library and access to foot traffic moving in all directions.
title: 6th Avenue, West Village - The Park View Store

building_name: Waterbury St, East Williamsburg - Event Space
description: East Williamsburg is Willamsburg’s little cousin, reminiscent of what Bedford Avenue might have been like 20 years ago. There are art galleries aplenty, new and old restaurants, and unique spaces like this pop up concert venue or event space for rent on Waterbury Street.
title: Waterbury St, East Williamsburg - Event Space

building_name: Evergreen Avenue, Bushwick - The White Pop Up
description: Located on the border of Bushwick and Bed Stuy is the great modern pop up event space for rent on Evergreen Ave. Three bathrooms and a kitchenette make it ideal for hosting.
title: Evergreen Avenue, Bushwick - The White Pop Up

building_name: Williamsburg Ground Floor Shop, Grand Street
description: Williamsburg is full of bars, restaurants, art galleries, and retail stores like this large pop-up shop to rent on Grand Street. It’s on the ground floor of a residential building and can be built out any way you like.
title: Williamsburg Ground Floor Shop, Grand Street

building_name: Troutman Street, Bushwick - The Open Warehouse
description: This empty warehouse for rent on the Bushwick side of the East Williamsburg border is ready to be reimagined as a raw backdrop for photo shoots, events, or fashion shows. The industrial space is set among converted warehouses with graffitied storefronts and is available for day use, after hours get togethers, and 24/7 creative projects. And when you’re done, you’ll have plenty of hangouts on the block for your guests or crew to unwind.
title: Troutman Street, Bushwick - The Open Warehouse

building_name: Centre Street, Manhattan - The Fifth Floor Event Space
description: On the aptly named Centre Street, this event space is located in the middle of downtown’s liveliest avenues for shopping and dining. The newly renovated space is sunny and sizable, with an open floor plan well suited for parties or conferences. Here, you’ll be sandwiched between SoHo’s boutiques a block to the West and the bars and bistros of Nolita and Little Italy on the blocks to your North and East.
title: Centre Street, Manhattan - The Fifth Floor Event Space

building_name: W 25th, Soho - Chelsea's Modern Gallery
description: Located amongst the best art galleries in New York, this pop up gallery space for rent is on W 25th St in Chelsea, and is modern, and in perfect shape to move in and set up your gallery.
title: W 25th, Soho - Chelsea's Modern Gallery

building_name: South Elmwood Ave, Montauk - The Indoor Beach House Pop up
description: Located just a 5-minute walk from Kirk Park Beach, the Montauk Beach House is a boutique hotel that offers this unique indoor pop up retail space for rent on South Elmwood Avenue.
title: South Elmwood Ave, Montauk - The Indoor Beach House Pop up

building_name: South Elmwood Ave, Montauk - The Beach House Pop up
description: You’ll be a quick 5-minute walk to Kirk Park Beach here at the Montauk Beach House. This boutique hotel is offering this unique outdoor pop up retail space for rent on South Elmwood Avenue.
title: South Elmwood Ave, Montauk - The Beach House Pop up

building_name: Myrtle Avenue, Brooklyn - The L Train Pop Up
description: This busy area of Bushwick under the L and M trains is full of great bars and Latin dining. Here on Myrtle Ave is a spacious pop up retail space for rent complete with storage space, and slatted walls to hang goods or artwork.

building_name: Beverly Glen Shopping Center Boutique
description: Located on the border of Beverly Glen and Bel Air, this pop up retail space for rent is in an exclusive high-end shopping center. It’s in great condition and ready for a brand to move in.
title: Beverly Glen Shopping Center Boutique

building_name: Williamsburg - Hope Street’s Large New Shopping Space
description: Williamsburg, an area that used to be known for artists in warehouses and bars, is now full of larger retailers like Whole Foods, an Apple store, and this really large space on Hope Street that will be perfect for a brand looking for a lot of space.
street: Williamsburg - Hope Street’s Large New Shopping Spac
title: Williamsburg - Hope Street’s Large New Shopping Space

building_name: Hope Street - Williamsburg’s New Corner Retail Space
description: Williamsburg has changed a lot over the years, and is now full of larger retailers like Whole Foods, an Apple store, and this really big space on Hope Street that will be perfect for a brand looking for a lot of space.
street: Hope Street - Williamsburg’s New Corner Retail Spac
title: Hope Street - Williamsburg’s New Corner Retail Space

building_name: Norfolk Street, The Lower East Side’s Brickwall Showroom
description: The Lower East Side has just about everything you could want in Manhattan, famous restaurants, dive bars, high-end and cheap shopping, and this large two-floor pop up space for rent that would be great for retail, or a restaurant on Norfolk Street.

building_name: Miami's Design District – Flagship Showroom
description: With a rooftop event space (with a retractable roof) and multiple large areas of private access with 30-foot high ceilings, this is an incomparably cool two-story flagship showroom space. With all current permits (including alcohol) this space in the heart of Miami's Design District is ready for you and your idea.
street: Miami's Design District – The Iconic Pos
title: Miami's Design District – The Iconic Post

description: If you’re looking for quintessential Brooklyn, Grand Street is the place to be. It’s still got the industrial aesthetic and grittiness of old-school Williamsburg. building_name: East Broadway - Lower Level Gallery
description: Located in the lower level of an existing art gallery, this pop-up gallery space for rent is ideal for anyone looking for a hands-off approach after set-up, as the space upstairs will be staffed and can work with you during opening hours.

building_name: Soho’s Large Mural Wall, Lafayette Street
description: On the corner of Lafayette and Grand Streets, this large brick mural on the side of a building makes an ideal space to rent for advertising. This is a perfect opportunity to stop the eyes of thousands and get your message across at this busy intersection. The Landlord can introduce you to an artist to do the work for you, too.

building_name: 2nd Avenue, Murray Hill – Corner Retail Store
description: Located on the corner of 3rd Avenue and 39th Street, this pop-up retail space for rent is conveniently located right near the Midtown Tunnel, and will get a ton of visibility with its large windows.
title: 2nd Avenue, Murray Hill – Corner Retail Store

building_name: Madison Avenue - Upper East Side Boutique
description: The Upper East Side is known for mansions, designer shops, Central Park views, and this lovely boutique retail space for rent on Madison Avenue.
street: Madison Avenue - Upper East Side Boutiqu
title: Madison Avenue - Upper East Side Boutique

building_name: Broadway Retail Space, The Bronx
description: Located just across the river from Manhattan, this busy area of The Bronx is full of retail shops, restaurants, and this very large pop-up retail space for rent on Broadway.
title: Broadway Retail Space, The Bronx

building_name: Williamsburg’s North 4th St. Large Storefront
description: Williamsburg is home to some of New York’s best bars and restaurants, parks, and shopping. Right opposite Whole Foods on North 4th Street, and this large pop-up retail or event space to rent comes with a large back yard.
title: Williamsburg’s North 4th St. Large Storefront

building_name: The Clinton Hill Beauty Bar
description: In between Fort Greene to the west and Bed-Stuy to the east, Clinton Hill is mostly known for being home to Pratt Institute, one of the best arts schools in the country. Myrtle Avenue, one of the main thoroughfares in Clinton Hill, has a number of restaurants, bars, and stores that are popular with the local younger crowd. This retail space (a former beauty salon) to rent has a large, open-concept layout.

building_name: Chelsea's Apartment-Style Space
description: Just off 7th Avenue, west 30th street is part of Chelsea’s vibrant art scene and surrounded by bustling cafes and sports bars to cater to the rush of tourists streaming in from the infamous Madison Square Garden arena. This sleek and contemporary loft apartment-style showroom (entered through the back of a coffee shop) is available to rent for unique retail concepts or events. It comes with an open-plan room with two adjacent side rooms and a separate shower room.

building_name: Greenwich Village Downstairs Private Dining Room
description: Located amongst the hip bars and restaurants of Greenwich Village is this large dining area space for rent located in the lower level of a large restaurant on W 8th Street. With two large tables, the room seats up to 60 people.
street: Greenwich Village Downstairs Private Dining Roo
title: Greenwich Village Downstairs Private Dining Room

building_name: Greenwich Village Private Event Space
description: Located in a large modern restaurant on W 8th Street, amongst the trendy bars and restaurants of Greenwich Village is this cozy modern dining space to rent for events and unique concepts. One long table seats 18 people.
title: Greenwich Village Private Event Space

building_name: Fulton Street, Bed Stuy – Brick Arch Retail Space
description: One of the most vibrant and evolving neighborhoods in Brooklyn, Bed Stuy is home to a mix of old New York with new bars and restaurants, and this large two-story pop-up retail or event space to rent on Fulton Street.
title: Fulton Street, Bed Stuy – Brick Arch Retail Space

building_name: Lower East Side – The Glass Gallery
description: Legendary nightlife, amazing food, and world-class art galleries – the Lower East Side is New York City at its best. Across from Sara D. Roosevelt Park, Forsyth Street is a picturesque thoroughfare lined with plenty shops and art galleries. Down the block from busy Delancey Street, this railroad-style art gallery is waiting to be filled for all kinds of new retail or gallery concepts.
street: Lower East Side – The Glass Galler
title: Lower East Side – The Glass Gallery

building_name: Madison Avenue, Midtown’s Versatile Space
description: Feel like Don Draper and Peggy Olsen with this Madison Avenue location, one of the most highly-desired addresses in New York. This large events, cafe or co-working space to rent is close to Koreatown and Madison Square Park.
title: Madison Avenue, Midtown’s Versatile Space

building_name: Bay Street, St. George’s Gallery Pop-Up
description: Just off the Staten Island Ferry, St. George is home to the Minor League Yankees stadium, the National Lighthouse Museum, and this spacious pop-up space for rent. With a backyard garden area and multiple rooms, this space would suit a gallery, showroom or retail concept.
title: Bay Street, St. George’s Gallery Pop-Up

building_name: Madison Street, Bushwick Event Space
description: Located off Broadway, this Bushwick event space to rent with a garden borders Bed Stuy, another one of Brooklyn’s most vibrant and happening neighborhoods. This large, open space is usually home to a community center, but it's commonly used for pop-up galleries.
title: Madison Street, Bushwick Event Space

building_name: West 35th Street – Hotel Showroom
description: West Chelsea is the insider’s go-to escape to get away from Times Square and Midtown Manhattan. The area has seen a ton of new developments recently, and is home to lots of great theaters and restaurants, as well as this pop-up showroom space to rent for events in the lobby of a hotel on West 35th Street.
title: West 35th Street – Hotel Showroom

building_name: West 35th Street – Hotel Showroom Space
description: West Chelsea is a wonderful escape from hectic Times Square and Midtown Manhattan. The area has seen a ton of new developments recently, and is home to lots of great theaters and restaurants, as well as this large showroom space to rent for events in the lobby of a hotel on West 35th Street.
title: West 35th Street – Hotel Showroom Space

building_name: Greenwich Village Event Space
description: Located in a large modern restaurant on W 8th Street, amongst the hip bars and restaurants of Greenwich Village is this large modern dining space to rent for events. With many different sized tables, the space holds at least 120 people.
title: Greenwich Village Event Space

building_name: Midtown East’s Soothing Showroom
description: Just off of Park Avenue, this 3rd floor pop up space for rent is beautifully designed as a medical office and segmented into rooms with privacy curtains. The building is full of doctors offices, dental practices and similar spaces.
title: Midtown East’s Soothing Showroom

building_name: Bushwick’s Corner Storefront
description: Right in the middle of one of Brooklyn's trendiest areas on a busy corner of Bushwick is this retail space to rent. On Thames Street, this space comes with another room in the back, which can be rented too if you need more space.
title: Bushwick’s Corner Storefront

building_name: Midtown’s Rooftop Event Space
description: Midtown is what people think of when they imagine New York City. From Times Square to Madison Square Garden and Grand Central Terminal, this is truly the most New York of New York City neighborhoods. This rooftop space for rent, right between Bryant Park and the Empire State Building, is great for events, and can be combined with the 4th floor space as well.
title: Midtown’s Rooftop Event Space

building_name: Midtown’s Exposed Brick Showroom
description: Midtown is what people think of when they imagine New York City. From Times Square to Madison Square Garden and Grand Central Terminal, this is truly the most New York of New York City neighborhoods. This 4th floor showroom or retail space for rent has great natural light.
title: Midtown’s Exposed Brick Showroom

building_name: Morgan Avenue’s Converted Bus Event Space
description: Located on one of East Williamsburg’s most popular streets, this stationary bus is decorated like a scene from Alice in Wonderland, and is ideal as a unique pop-up event or activation space.
street: Morgan Avenue’s Converted Bus Event Spac
title: Morgan Avenue’s Converted Bus Event Space

building_name: Hell’s Kitchen - 8th Floor Gallery & Event Space
description: Hell’s Kitchen is the place to go for people looking to escape the tourist traps of Times Square and Midtown. The area has seen a recent revival, and is now home to many theaters and restaurants, as well as this great gallery and event space for rent on the eighth floor.
street: Hell’s Kitchen - 8th Floor Gallery & Event Spac
title: Hell’s Kitchen - 8th Floor Gallery & Event Space

building_name: Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn - The Red Awning Gallery
description: Prospect Heights is a slice of true Brooklyn, a good mix of old-school charm and new trendy bars and restaurants. The neighborhood is home to Grand Army Plaza and the Brooklyn Museum, as well as this pop up space to rent for retail or as a gallery.
title: Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn - The Red Awning Gallery

building_name: Wooster Street , Soho - Black and White Shop
description: You’ll be surrounded by boutique shops and trendy restaurants here in Soho if you move into this pop up retail space for rent on Wooster Street. The white walls and layout would also make this a great art gallery.
title: Wooster Street , Soho - Black and White Shop

building_name: Fulton Street, Downtown Brooklyn – Antique Restaurant
description: Downtown Brooklyn, as its name suggests, is the commercial and financial hub of the entire borough of Brooklyn. The Fulton Mall is home to over 150 retailers and the center of Downtown Brooklyn’s business district. Office workers on their breaks and students out of school for the day congregate here to shop at the many chain stores and discount shops that line the streets. On Fulton Street, this historic restaurant is fully fitted with antique light fixtures and a big back room storage area.
title: Fulton Street, Downtown Brooklyn – Antique Restaurant

building_name: Upper West Side – The West 79th Street White Gallery
description: Set up shop amongst some of NYC’s richest cultural institutions: Lincoln Center, Juilliard, and the Beacon Theatre. In front of the American Museum of Natural History and close to Central Park, this three-floor gallery space with a basement storage area used to be home to a Yoko Ono gallery.
street: Upper West Side – The West 79th Street White Galler
title: Upper West Side – The West 79th Street White Gallery

building_name: West 79th Street, Upper West Side – The White Brick Cafe
description: Right in front of Theodore Roosevelt Park and the Museum of Natural History, this corner cafe is well-placed in front of tourists, locals and out-of-towners. The space already comes with fridges and a coffee machine, and there's a basement for storage, too.
title: West 79th Street, Upper West Side – The White Brick Cafe

building_name: Kent Ave. - The Corner Warehouse
description: This edge of Williamsburg has it’s industrial theme with less crowds and vestiges of bulk trade and commerce. It’s quaint and edgy, carrying the original vibes that brought art, dance, and experimentation to this neighborhood. Rent a large warehouse space surrounded by other warehouses - bring back old Williamsburg.
title: Kent Ave. - The Corner Warehouse

building_name: White Street, Tribeca’s Hallowed Hall
description: Tribeca is home to some of the city's best restaurants like Little Park and Takahachi, as well as this massive hall event space to rent in the Tribeca Synagogue, between 6th Avenue and Broadway.
title: White Street, Tribeca’s Hallowed Hall

building_name: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn – Skylighted Event Space
description: One block away from the Brooklyn favorite Dough Doughnuts and a short walk from Pratt Institute, Clifton Place is in the middle of some of the best Bed-Stuy nightlife. This loft event space for rent has plenty of original details including exposed beams and skylights for plenty of natural light.
title: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn – Skylighted Event Space

building_name: South 5th Street, Williamsburg – The Black Gallery
description: South Williamsburg is often described as the Williamsburg of ten years ago, with vestiges of its industrial past and quiet city blocks on display. But on Broadway, nightlife spots like Trophy Bar and Baby’s All Right are transforming this section of Williamsburg into a little Bedford Avenue. On South 5th Street, around the corner from Broadway, sits this gallery space and shop for rent.
title: South 5th Street, Williamsburg – The Black Gallery

building_name: Hunter Street, Long Island City - Showroom Space
description: A former industrial desert, Long Island City has experienced extraordinary change over the years. An influx of new developments are popping up at a constant rate to keep up with all the new residents moving into this area. Over on Hunter Street, this shop space for rent has two long rooms for showcasing your idea.
title: Hunter Street, Long Island City - Showroom Space

building_name: Broadway, Tribeca – The Red Brick Boutique
description: On the border of upscale, celebrity-centric Tribeca, and downtown cool Soho – it doesn’t get more fashionable than this section of Broadway. Cobblestone streets give way to airy lofts with cast-iron facades that house well-heeled apartment dwellers. On Broadway, this retail space for rent is adorned with original red-brick walls and is surrounded on all sides by stylish boutiques, art galleries, and high-end department stores.
title: Broadway, Tribeca – The Red Brick Boutique

building_name: Hoboken – The Grey Gallery on Harrison Street
description: New Jersey is long overdue for a reappraisal. Often overlooked by tourists in favor of the alluring charms of NYC, Hoboken is a thriving community that rivals Murray Hill in terms of restaurants, shops, and nightlife. A few blocks from the Hudson River and the Hoboken train station, this industrial-chic gallery space provides a backdrop that’s interesting and  visually striking, making it the perfect canvas for any special  event.
street: Hoboken – The Grey Gallery on Harrison Stree
title: Hoboken – The Grey Gallery on Harrison Street

building_name: 9th Ave – Hell’s Kitchen Commercial Event Space
description: West of the Theater District and the cacophonous noise of Times Square, 9th Ave is a welcome respite from the tourist traps that are easy to get sucked into when you’re in Midtown. People come to 9th Ave for a more authentic experience away from the more materialistic side of the city. Hell’s Kitchen is the place to be and where you’ll find this massive event space with a commercial kitchen that’s located on the ground floor of the Cassa Hotel.
street: 9th Ave – Hell’s Kitchen Commercial Event Spac
title: 9th Ave – Hell’s Kitchen Commercial Event Space

building_name: Bushwick – The Thames Street Loft
description: Bordering the young and fashionable (and expensive) neighborhood of Williamsburg, and next door to historic Bed-Stuy, Bushwick has garnered a reputation all its own as being a destination for a flourishing creative community. On Thames Street, a short walk from the immensely popular Roberta’s, this bright and airy space for rent was previously an artist loft. The space comes with a functional photo studio and includes photography equipment.
title: Bushwick – The Thames Street Loft

building_name: VR Studio Event Space, Orchard Street
description: Iconic for its low-rise tenement buildings and discount shopping, Orchard Street has made its mark as a destination to experience the eclectic Lower East Side. From world-class restaurants to live music venues, this area of Manhattan is home to NYC institutions Katz’s Deli and Russ & Daughters. Around the corner, this former VR studio with two floors is well-suited for hosting special events. Whatever the idea, the Landlord can create and customise different VR experiences for you to bring something unexpected to your customers.
title: VR Studio Event Space, Orchard Street

building_name: Ford Street, Crown Heights – Showroom Space
description: Home to a growing number of small businesses and many museums, Crown Heights adds something special to Brooklyn’s varied mix of neighborhoods. This space for rent with an outdoor terrace sits on the residential Ford Street, next to the popular Lincoln Terrace Park. It's part of a smart-looking residential building, and can be used for retail concepts or as a showroom.
title: Ford Street, Crown Heights – Showroom Space

building_name: Blake Avenue, Brooklyn – Pop Up Boutique
description: Brooklyn's easternmost neighborhood, East New York, is currently experiencing a revival. This gritty urban landscape is the backdrop to a growing number of small businesses – all catering heavily towards locals. This retro-looking retail showroom for rent inside an old-school townhouse building is unique to the area.
title: Blake Avenue, Brooklyn – Pop Up Boutique

building_name: Rego Park, Queens – The Marketplace
description: Home to a diverse population, Rego Park in Queens has plenty to offer its residents and visitors. It's got a huge shopping center that's become a major destination for the area and many specialty food stores, too. Previously home to a holiday market, this large retail and events space for rent on 63rd Road spans across two floors and includes a loft with an office area.
title: Rego Park, Queens – The Marketplace

building_name: East Village – The Little Blue Shop
description: Nothing exemplifies New York more than the East Village, where the culinary and bar scene is highly talked-about and head-turning street style is the norm. This little shop for rent is centrally located on East 11th Street, one block from Tompkins Square Park.
street: East Village – The Little Blue Sho
title: East Village – The Little Blue Shop

building_name: The Pop-Up Shop in Bed-Stuy
description: Bed-Stuy is often given the label of being an emerging neighborhood, but everything that makes it a such a unique area can be found on Marcus Garvey Blvd. From the distinctive 19th century architecture to the mom and pop shops that dot the landscape, this pop-up (or retail) shop for rent is an empty space waiting to be taken over with your idea.
title: The Pop-Up Shop in Bed-Stuy

building_name: Warren Street, Tribeca - Studio Space
description: Moments from City Hall, this narrow street connecting Broadway and Church Street in the fashionable Tribeca neighbourhood combines old-school New York shops and family-friendly restaurants with modern art spaces and offices. Located on the second floor of a mostly residential pre-war building and formerly used as a yoga studio, this bright, versatile space to rent could be used for anything from sports and retail to creative pop-ups.
title: Warren Street, Tribeca - Studio Space

building_name: Wall Street, FiDi - Luxury Event Space with Terraces
description: Located in the heart of the Financial District, Wall Street is arguably one of New York’s most famous addresses, with its iconic buildings known for everything from big businesses to incredible architecture. On the 23rd floor of a high-end residential building, this light, open-plan event and showroom space to rent has a range of seating areas with views over Lower Manhattan, two private terraces and even a basketball court!
title: Wall Street, FiDi - Luxury Event Space with Terraces

building_name: East Village - The Black Box Theatre
description: In New York’s downtown district, the East Village is known for it’s laid-back charm and eclectic nightlife. With a history bedded in the radical art scene of the 60s, this part of Manhattan is home to some of the city’s most notorious dive bars, cool hangouts and creative events. More formally known as the East Village Playhouse, the black box theatre is a unique pop-up space ideal for retailers to showcase their brand.
street: East Village - The Black Box Theatr
title: East Village - The Black Box Theatre

building_name: Hudson Street - Large Shop Space
description: Hudson Street puts you right in the middle of a busy thoroughfare that connects Tribeca to the West Village. This Hudson Square location is a melting pot of people and businesses – from the music crowd catching a jazz show at Blue Note to the advertising execs taking a lunch break at Westville Hudson. This newly white-boxed large shop space to let would suit an experiential pop-up concept.
title: Hudson Street - Large Shop Space

building_name: Bowery – The White Showroom
description: This stretch of Bowery street is essentially the “Jeweler’s Row” of Chinatown: a place to happily burn a hole in your pocket, and your stomach too, with all the laid-back Asian food spots close by. Hot-off of a fresh renovation, this showroom space for rent can be used for both retail concepts and art galleries. View the floorplan for this space.
title: Bowery – The White Showroom

building_name: Jefferson Street - Urban Chic Space
description: Jefferson Street is where Bushwick is the center of attention that falls on the House of Yes. It is an attractive neighborhood with a community of residents and small business owners. Rent a large building with two floors, a lounge and bar space downstairs and a yoga studio space upstairs.
title: Jefferson Street - Urban Chic Space

building_name: Marcus Garvey, Bed-Stuy – Showroom
description: Past Bed-Stuy’s well-kept brownstones and unkempt storefronts, locally-owned neighborhood delis, convenience shops continue to be joined by a growing number of renovated bars, cafes and retail spaces. On the corner of Halsey Street, this former Richard Beavers gallery space is now available to rent.
title: Marcus Garvey, Bed-Stuy – Showroom

building_name: Grand Street, Williamsburg – Rustic Basement Bar
description: If Williamsburg had a heart, this hipster-ridden intersection of Bedford and Grand is exactly where you’d find it. Pulsating with life through its countless artisanal shops, rustic bars and gourmet food joints, the area also houses this cozy event space for 20 to 30 people, located in the basement of an upscale Japanese-style steakhouse.
title: Grand Street, Williamsburg – Rustic Basement Bar

building_name: Williamsburg, 7th Street – White-Boxed Shop
description: Take a walk down North 7th Street in Williamsburg and you'll see why this neighborhood is so popular. From the excitement of tourists and shoppers on Bedford to the quiet of the East River along the waterfront. Centrally located on North 7th Street is this flexible retail space for rent.
title: Williamsburg, 7th Street – White-Boxed Shop
